import React, { Component } from "react"; import Header from "../Component/Header/Header"; import Footer from "../Component/Footer/Footer"; import Viewing from "../Component/Viewing/Viewing"; import CourseService from "../Services/courseService"; import reduxAction from "../Store/Action/action"; import { FETCH_COURSE_DETAIL } from "../Store/Action/type"; import { connect } from "react-redux"; import { Link } from "react-router-dom"; const courseService = new CourseService(); class CourseDetailPage extends Component { constructor(props) { super(props) this.state = { showGoCart: false } } // componentDidMount() { // // lấy tham số mã khóa học từ url // const { courseid } = this.props.match.params; // courseService // .fetchCourseDetail(courseid) // .then(res => { // this.props.dispatch(reduxAction(FETCH_COURSE_DETAIL, res.data)); // }) // .catch(err => { // console.log(err); // }); // } static getDerivedStateFromProps = (prevProps, nextState) => { let cart = JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("cart")) ? JSON.parse(localStorage.getItem("cart")) : []; let index = cart.findIndex(item => { return item.maKhoaHoc === prevProps.course.maKhoaHoc; }); if (index !== -1) { nextState.showGoCart = true } return null; } onAdd = courseDetail => { this.props.dispatch(reduxAction("ADD_TO_CART",courseDetail)); }; render() { let { courseDetail ,course } = this.props; console.log(this.props.courseDetail); return (

Robert Richards
Category

{courseDetail.luotXem} reviews

It’s easy to go down the rabbit hole of libraries and tools only to come out of it not knowing how to build and launch a real-world React application. You get things configured, but you’re not sure how the libraries fit together (or if you’re even using the right one).

What you'll learn
  • Learn to use Python professionally, learning both Python 2 and Python 3!
  • Learn advanced Python features, like the collections module and how to work with timestamps!
  • Understand complex topics, like decorators.
  • Get an understanding of how to create GUIs in the Jupyter Notebook system!
  • Create games with Python, like Tic Tac Toe and Blackjack!
  • Learn to use Object Oriented Programming with classes!
  • Understand how to use both the Jupyter Notebook and create .py files
  • Build a complete understanding of Python! from the ground up!
